glsa.title: OpenMotif: Multiple vulnerabilities in libXpm
glsa.synopsis: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in libXpm, which is included in OpenMotif, that can potentially lead to remote code execution.

background.p: OpenMotif provides a free version of the Motif toolkit for open source applications.

description.p: Multiple vulnerabilities, such as buffer overflows, out of bounds memory access or directory traversals, have been discovered in libXpm that is shipped as a part of the X Window System (see GLSA 200409-34 and 200411-28). OpenMotif, an application that includes this library, suffers from the same issues.

impact.p: A carefully-crafted XPM file could crash applications making use of the OpenMotif toolkit, potentially allowing the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the application.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All OpenMotif users should upgrade to the latest version:
Note: You should run 'revdep-rebuild' to ensure that all applications linked to OpenMotif are properly rebuilt.
